dt.t: To keep a {wi}finished{/wi} drawing from being smeared or soiled, spray it with a fixative.
Converting inputs into {wi}finished{/wi} goods and services is the essential function of every economic organization.
a house with a {wi}finished{/wi} basement/attic {gloss}=a basement/attic that has floors, ceilings, and walls like the rooms in the main part of the house{/gloss}

dt: {bc}provided with a {d_link|finish|finish:2} {bc}having a final treatment or coating on the surface

dt.t: a shop that sells {wi}finished{/wi} oak furniture

shortdef: entirely done : brought to a completed state
provided with a finish : having a final treatment or coating on the surface
marked by the highest quality : consummate

dt: {bc}to come to the end of a course, task, or undertaking

dt.t: I shall {wi}finish{/wi} with a Chopin nocturne
decided to {wi}finish{/wi} with him for good

dt: {bc}to end a competition in a specified manner or position

dt.t: hope to {wi}finish{/wi} their new home before winter

dt: {bc}to put a final coat or surface on
{bc}to defeat or ruin utterly and finally

pt: {sc}close{/sc} {sc}end{/sc} {sc}conclude{/sc} {sc}finish{/sc} {sc}complete{/sc} {sc}terminate{/sc} mean to bring or come to a stopping point or limit. {sc}close{/sc} usually implies that something has been in some way open as well as unfinished.
{sc}end{/sc} conveys a strong sense of finality.
{sc}conclude{/sc} may imply a formal closing (as of a meeting).
{sc}finish{/sc} may stress completion of a final step in a process.

pt.t: after it is painted, the house will be {it}finished{/it}

pt: {sc}complete{/sc} implies the removal of all deficiencies or a successful finishing of what has been undertaken.

pt.t: the resolving of this last issue {it}completes{/it} the agreement

pt: {sc}terminate{/sc} implies the setting of a limit in time or space.

et: Middle English {it}finisshen,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}finiss-,{/it} stem of {it}finir,{/it} going back to Latlin {it}fīnīre{/it} "to mark out the boundaries, limit, put an end to, bring to a close," derivative of {it}fīnis{/it} "boundary, limit, ending" {ma}{mat|final:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to come to an end : terminate
to come to the end of a course, task, or undertaking

dt: {bc}a basement or attic that has floors, ceilings, and walls like the rooms in the main part of the house

shortdef: a basement or attic that has floors, ceilings, and walls like the rooms in the main part of the house

dt: {bc}to have no further need for (something) {bc}to stop using (something)

dt.t: Could I see the newspaper when you {it}finish with{/it} it?

dt: {bc}to stop being involved with (someone) {bc}to end a romantic relationship with (someone)

dt.t: She and her boyfriend had another fight, and now she says she's going to {it}finish with{/it} him once and for all.

dt: {bc}to stop dealing with, working on, or punishing (someone or something)

dt.t: When I {it}finish with{/it} him he'll be sorry!

shortdef: to have no further need for (something) : to stop using (something)
to stop being involved with (someone) : to end a romantic relationship with (someone)
to stop dealing with, working on, or punishing (someone or something)
